reviews.text: The Astor House is in a great location within a couple of minutes you can be strolling along the bund admiring the pudong across the river. This you cannot fault.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby was ok not very grand but very colonial. Staff were friendly and helpful we didn't experience any problems with them and they were happy to write down the places where we wanted to go in Chinese. The Doorman would go and hail us taxi's (sometimes taking him a good 10 minutes before one would stop) and then instructing the driver where to take us, which certainly made things alot less stressful.
reviews.title: Avoid the Astor!

likes.disliked: — The dirty carpets throughout the hotel

reviews.text: We had a deluxe room on what was the celebrity floor (lots of celebrity stayed here in its hey day) on the third floor. The hallways on this floor were really nice again very colonial with lamposts to light them and little benches to sit and wait for people. Lots of glass cases explaining the history of the hotel and who's stayed there.
reviews.title: Go executive or look at the room first

reviews.text: Our room was huge with two twin beds that were like sleeping on rock. The bathroom was large too and recently refurbished, the shower was powerful and water was always hot. Both the room and bathroom were spotless. But the AC and mini- fridge in the room were a noisy when you were trying to sleep at night. The wooden floors meant you heard everyone coming and going all the time.
reviews.title: Wonderful Astor House

reviews.text: If you want to stay here soon, beware of the construction. Sign in room says apologies for noise from construction beginning at 8:30am, but it started promptly at 6:30am --even on Saturday & Sunday. Complained at 6:30am to asst. manager at front counter with the sign in hand but nothing was done about it, though she acted concerned. We're talking jack hammers and pounding here, folks. At check-in we got a complimentary upgrade to a room on the 5th floor --mistake as jackhammer was immediately above us. Incredibly noisy and the hallways were filthy with dust. Adding insult to injury, our shower was backed up. The view? AMAZING. Great location right off the Bund, and attached restaurant was pretty terrific too. At check-out we had to argue our way out of the mini-bar beer charges, which we didn't drink but the staff was pretty insolent in insisting we had. We are not young nor dressed as some grubby world travelers, but got the treatment anyway. Saw a lot of backpackers, which for such a Grand Dame is not necessarily a good sign. Astor is prime for some boutique hotel chain to swoop in & turn it into a 5-star experience, but as it is I'd say "pass".
reviews.title: Construction daily (weekends, too) starting at 6:30am promptly

reviews.text: The Astor House Hotel is indeed a unique experience, it's history from entrance to exit, with oodles of historical information about the Hotel and Shanghai City. In fact, during my stay bucketloads of tourists wandered the hotel photographing and looking at the various murals and pictures dotted around.
reviews.title: Unique experience...but not for me thanks

reviews.text: I originally had a standard room, however this was very dark and had a strong smell plus no view so decided to upgrade to a Deluxe room (405). This section of the hotel is possible the most charismatic part, with wood floors and brick walls and huge doors to the rooms.
reviews.title: Would not do it again
Good place - could be fantastic
reviews.text: The room I had was huge, with high ceiling and wood floor, remote TV, minibar, ensuite bath/shower and 2 single beds. But the beds were rock hard, the air con didn't work well probably due to the characteristics of the room and the bathroom although clean was old and in need of updating - the water pressure was virtually non existent at times.

reviews.title: Not Just Another Tourist Hotel.
reviews.text: No sign of a smile at check in or check out, breakfast options are limited and somewhat bland and tastless, served in a hall that looks like it hosts wedding receptions & discos.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice historic hotel located pretty close to the Bund, which is along the Huangpu river. Our room was large with a modern bathroom, comfortable bed and all the normal amenities. Service was good and the breakfast buffet was v ery well-stocked and tasty. I would stay here again - decent value for the money.
reviews.title: Nice historic hotel - good value!

reviews.text: Back to Shanghai to show this amazing place to my boy, he loved it too, especially shopping. Picked up Astor as per TripAdvisor reviews. Room huge, place very authentic we loved it. Stayed for 3 nights, good value for money, close to Nanjing road, walking distance, next to Bund, loved Shanghai food, staff were nice, polite and helpful, not good English but they try, simple it was excellent stay.
reviews.title: Loved Astor & Shanghai
nice buiding, but...
reviews.text: The Hotel itself is set in a really nice old building andf has (including the bellguide wearing some kind of kilt) some colonial style. It s lokated close to the bund. But the bridge leading there is currently gone and is going to rebuild what takes a while and will be noisy. It s not too far to the next bridge, about a 15 minute detour by foot. The next Metro stop is around 20 Minutes away by foot.

Unfortunately there is also a huge construction site round the hotel, they are building some road tunnel underneath the river. The construction will go on for quite a while. The site is very noisy and the work round the clock. Sometimes stopping during the day but surely starting to work right when you want to go to sleep. Very noisy. the Hotel offered us other rooms, but some of them were very dark and wet, the others had construction noise, too.
reviews.title: Looks great........

reviews.text: The hotel itself is not to noisy, you may hear the neighbours tv a bit and the walking around of the upper ones, but its a very old building (you hear the mice running inside the walls and ceiling during the night), so keep that in mind when booking.

Lovable, right down to its flaws
reviews.text: One piece of advice, make sure you have a reservation, I showed up without one thinking that I would get a discounted rate, and instead they tried to charge for $150 for a normal room, then refused to work something out with me. I told them that on the internet, there own website, that the room is $80, they did not want to listen and the to my surprise, told me to go and book it on the internet then!!!! I was amazed how unreasonable they were. So I told them I would be back soon, annoyingly, then went to internet cafe in hotel, booked at hotels.com for $69 a night for 5 nights. They were slightly annoyed when I came back 10 mins later. So be warned the staff at reception can be akward and no accomodation.
Overall hotel was great, great price, great location, very clean, and huge room. Could not have asked for more. the minor annoyance in booking the room in no way took away for the my stay.
reviews.title: Loved this quirky hotel

reviews.text: Astor house certainly isn't a newly appointed international chain hotel but it is quality nonetheless. It purports to be the oldest western hotel in Asia... whether or not this is true it has a great sense of history and oodles of charm (and, yes, character). I stayed in one of the penthouse suites on the sixth floor. While the carpets have seen better days the room was so very very comfortable. Maybe because I was on the top floor (not the most expensive rooms I should add) I never even noticed the construction work others have mentioned. I had little dealing with the staff (check in and check out, that was it) but they seemed friendly enough, at least by shanghai standards. All in all a great experience, and I'll definately stay here next time I'm in town.
reviews.title: Full of character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very much enjoyed coming back each night to the Astor House.
reviews.title: Olde worlde charm

reviews.text: I was in Shanghai on business, with a budget of between C$80 and C$110 a night. That will get you an executive room at the Astor House. It's worth it. The rooms are in a different section from the rest of the hotel, with seperate staff. The reception people downstairs are very grim, but I found the executive staff quite helpful.
reviews.title: Go executive if you can afford it

reviews.text: During my first say I had a room facing the Russian embassy across the road, which was ok, but the window had scaffolding outside. The room was large, nice hardwood floors, great internet access for free.
reviews.title: Won't stay anywhere else!
Loved the Astor House!
reviews.text: During my second stay, I had another room which was even bigger. The wall between the bathroom and the bedroom was glass (with a drop down screen) with speakers under the sink. After 5 exhausting weeks on the road, my last night in China was spent in bliss in the very large bathtub watching a Mad Max movie on the TV (With dozens of CCTV Chinese language channels, and just two English options -- CNN and HBO -- you can't be picky about what you watch.)
I would stay at the Astor again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Not perfect, but good enough

reviews.text: We booked our room through Orbitz, but were given a complimentary upgrade to the Executive floor. The staff at the check in on this floor were very helpful, and always pleasant. Great views from our room, and we loved the spaciousness of the place. Yes the beds were hard, but this is kind of standard in many hotels in China (fortunately it suited us fine...).
reviews.title: Astor House has charm & a great location
A unique experience
reviews.text: I stayed at the Astor House Hotel for two nights in December. I have to say that from the moment you step into the place and walk down the halls of the hotel you really feel as though you are going back in time. I stayed in a deluxe twin room (booked via internet)and it was the biggest room I have ever stayed in. There were two single beds and a whole set of living room furniture: sofa, two arm-chairs and a large coffee table. There was ample closet space and a writing desk with two very comfortable chairs. The bathroom was quite big and recently re-done. However the shower-head didn't provide an even-flow of water. That said, this was a minor inconvenience. The room had two balconies from which I could see the river and the area near Nanjing Rd. If anything, location alone is worth it! I wondered about proper heating in a room that large (Shanghai can get very cold in winter especially at night) and the heating system was excellent. I was able to control the heating myself and it never took more than about five minutes for the room to get toasty warm.
The staff at the hotel were friendly although they spoke limited English. That said, the assistant manager had a desk in the foyer and he was quite helpful with a good command of English.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: The hotel draws quite a varied clientele given the vast range of rates and types of accomodation from dorms to executive suites. As such, that really seems to add more to the personality of the place.
reviews.title: great surprise
